quoteText: Grammarly uses cookies and similar technologies, including tracking pixels and web beacons, to collect usage and analytic data that helps us provide our Site, Software, and/or Services to you, as well as to help deliver ads for relevant Grammarly products and services to you when you visit certain pages on the Site and then visit certain third-party sites.
title: The service may use tracking pixels, web beacons, browser fingerprinting, and/or device fingerprinting on users.

tosdr.case: The service may use tracking pixels, web beacons, browser fingerprinting, and/or device fingerprinting on users.
tosdr.tldr: Grammarly uses third-party cookies to track your preferences and profile information, as well as general usage and volume stats, which don't include personal information. The web beacons are used along with cookies to analyze how their site is used, and to gauge how effective their customer communications and marketing campaigns are. For example, they know how many users access a specific page and which links they clicked on.
